definition: to light a lamp/to raise a lantern
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
lamp/light/lantern/CL:盞|盏[zhan3]
to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to sow discord/to provoke

sentences.english: He has the habit of burning the midnight oil before tests.
sentences.chinese: 考试前他有挑灯夜战的习惯。

sentences.english: I have to burn the midnight oil to complete the report.
sentences.chinese: 我必须挑灯夜战来完成此报告。

sentences.english: Many corners are still on, working or corrupting.
sentences.chinese: 很多角落依然在挑灯夜战，或忙碌或堕落。

sentences.english: We have to go home and burn the midnight oil tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我们必须回家挑灯夜战。

sentences.english: I have to study every night.
sentences.chinese: 我每晚都得挑灯夜战了。

sentences.english: The Strip long, fireworks fan, you stay back to see.
sentences.chinese: 长街长，烟花繁，你挑灯回看。

sentences.english: We don't hold a candle to Europe whn it comes to African colonialism.
sentences.chinese: 谈到欧洲对非洲殖民，我们不需要挑灯读历史。

sentences.english: I pulled an all-nighter to study for my English exam.
sentences.chinese: 我挑灯夜战准备我的英文考试。

sentences.english: The Strip, fireworks propagation, you all look back.
sentences.chinese: 长街长，烟花繁，你挑灯回看。

sentences.english: Each of them mounted fresh horses to start the night fight.
sentences.chinese: 二人各换一匹马，开始了挑灯夜战。

sentences.english: He used to burn the midnight oil before exam.
sentences.chinese: 他过去考试前总要挑灯夜战。

sentences.english: I can see you now: sitting at your desk by lamplight, alone on a Saturday night.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了你，周六独自在台前挑灯夜读。

sentences.english: He studied night after night in the week before the exam.
sentences.chinese: 考试前一个星期，他每天都挑灯夜读。

sentences.english: So the day to take part in physical labor, secretly stay up at night study.
sentences.chinese: 于是白天参加劳动，晚上偷偷挑灯学习。

sentences.english: More and more pupils are burning the midnight oil.
sentences.chinese: 愈来愈多的学生都在挑灯夜战。

definition: variant of 炳燭|炳烛[bing3 zhu2]
midnight
a life of strenuous studies (idiom)
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
the whole night
long dark night/fig. long period of misery and oppression
to bend over one's desk (writing, studying, taking a nap etc)
late at night/in the dead of night
to be sleepless all night
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
to write at a tremendous speed
deep at night and all is quiet (idiom)
water clock used to mark night watches
to search for the right word (of poet)
deep night
in the dead of night (idiom)
